info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 11 at 1:18PM PST until December 15 at 4:00AM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 4500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Esmeralda and Central Nye County. * WHEN...From 4 AM Tuesday to 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible due to blowing and drifting snow. Road closures are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...US-95 between Tonopah and Beatty will be impacted with heavy snow. Additional roadways affected include Highway 6 and Highway 264 in Esmeralda County including Dyer, as well as Goldfield Summit. Additionally, heavy snow is likely in the higher elevations of the Nevada National Security Site in Nye county.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.
